title: True Life The Musical: With Rick Mersel
description:
Push Comedy Theater Brings you True Life The Musical!

Each month, a different guest storyteller from the community will tell stories based on audience suggestions. Then the cast will make up scenes and songs on the spot inspired by those stories!

With the ever talented Andy Poindexter to make up the music for each of the songs!

Don't miss this night of Comedy, Music, and Stories!

True Life The Musical: With Rick Mersel

Thursday, March 14th, 8pm

Tickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Venetian Blinds: The Improvised Film Noir
description:
It's Venetian Blinds’ debut show!

Prepare yourself to be thrown into an evening of sleazy crime, dangerous dames and dirty deeds.  Two sets of booze and cigarettes. It all starts at 10pm, and only costs a measly five clams.

“Everybody is somebody’s fool” - The Lady From Shanghai (1947)

Venetian Blinds: The Improvised Film Noir takes you into the gritty cinematic world filled with hard-boiled private eyes, dangerous women, and a seedy underworld of criminals and crooked cops. Evan Hartley and Bobby Mercer know how to combine crime and comedy into a hilarious show for the ages.

Venetian Blinds: The Improvised Film Noir

Saturday, March 16th at 10pm

title: Harold Night
description:
It's Harold Night at the Push Comedy Theater!

So who the heck is Harold? More accurately the question should be... what the heck is a Harold?

The Harold is the big, bad grand daddy of all long form improv! It starts with an audience suggestion, then improvisers weave together scenes, characters and group games to create a seamless piece. It can be bizarre and magical, baffling and amazing... it definitely needs to be seen.

title: Clique Bait - An SNL-Style Comedy Show from The Pre Madonnas
description:
The Pre Madonnas present “Clique Bait”

There's a lot of funny stuff on the internet these days. Between memes, political commentary, viral videos, and "hold my beer" moments, where do you turn for original, scripted comedy when every minute is precious? Enter The Pre Madonnas!

Fresh off being awarded "Group of the Year for 2018" by their peers at The Push Comedy Theater, "Clique Bait" will have you doubled over laughing with all new material. The Pre Madonnas are a diverse group with eclectic talents based in Norfolk, VA bringing many unique perspectives to form a wild sense of humor. If they had to give themselves a rating, it would be a throbbing PG-13 (but no guarantees after 10PM).

Tickets are $10 and can be bought ahead of time or at the door. Push Comedy Theater has a history of selling out all 99 seats, so we highly recommend buying tickets in advance, and arriving at the theater early to get a great seat!

.

There is limited parking in the lot directly across from the theater. Parking is also available on the surrounding streets, but be mindful of the posted signage.

Contact: thepremadonnas@gmail.com

Twitter: @ Pre_Madonnas

Instagram: @thepremadonnas

title: ​The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!
description: The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!Comedy dies in darkness.The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy group brings their non-stop energy to the Push Comedy Theater stage for a live comedy show that you do not want to miss!WHAT IS IT???Sketch comedy: Ever seen SNL, Mad TV, Key & Peele? Crazy scenarios, weird props & costumes, bizarre characters! The only difference: You are in the live audience!Improv comedy: Chicago-style long form improv. Don't worry, it's nothing like Chicago-style pizza. It's actually good! The Bright Side gets one word from the audience and uses it to make up an entire set of hilarious scenes on-the-spot!WHO IS IT???The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy is a group of four friends - Matt Cole, Brian Garraty, Andrea Bourguignon, and Drew Richard - formed in 2015 from the Push Comedy Theater in Norfolk, VA. Their particular brand of comedy is a celebration of the absurdity of the mundane world. Audiences at a Bright Side show can expect to see smart, polished comedy that reflects the group’s bizarre, unrelentingly optimistic perspective. Look on The Bright Side!WHEN & WHERE IS IT???The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!!Sunday, March 24th @ 7 p.m.Push Comedy TheaterTickets $10Come out to see and support one of Hampton Road's own sketch comedy groups at the intimate Push Comedy Theater in the heart of the new Norfolk Arts District!
full_description:
The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!
Comedy dies in darkness.

The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy group brings their non-stop energy to the Push Comedy Theater stage for a live comedy show that you do not want to miss!

WHAT IS IT???

Sketch comedy: Ever seen SNL, Mad TV, Key & Peele? Crazy scenarios, weird props & costumes, bizarre characters! The only difference: You are in the live audience!

Improv comedy: Chicago-style long form improv. Don't worry, it's nothing like Chicago-style pizza. It's actually good! The Bright Side gets one word from the audience and uses it to make up an entire set of hilarious scenes on-the-spot!

WHO IS IT???

The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy is a group of four friends - Matt Cole, Brian Garraty, Andrea Bourguignon, and Drew Richard - formed in 2015 from the Push Comedy Theater in Norfolk, VA. Their particular brand of comedy is a celebration of the absurdity of the mundane world. Audiences at a Bright Side show can expect to see smart, polished comedy that reflects the group’s bizarre, unrelentingly optimistic perspective. Look on The Bright Side!

WHEN & WHERE IS IT???

The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!!
Sunday, March 24th @ 7 p.m.
Push Comedy Theater
Tickets $10

Come out to see and support one of Hampton Road's own sketch comedy groups at the intimate Push Comedy Theater in the heart of the new Norfolk Arts District!

title: Nerdvana presents: Harry Potter and the Cauldron of Comedy
description:
Nerdvana Presents Harry Potter and the Cauldron of Comedy

Riddikulus!!!!

Get ready for Harry Potter and the Cauldron of Comedy... a comedy show for people who love (or even mildly like) Harry Potter. You may be asking, why do a Harry Potter show now?!?!

With Harry Potter and the Cauldron of Comedy we're taking a little bit of improv, a little bit of sketch comedy, and... Expelliarmus... we get an amazing Harry Potter themed comedy show.

We'll have a few Harry Potter themed surprises in store for you, plus everyone who comes in a Harry Potter inspired costume will get in for free. So whether you're a Gryffindor or Slytherin, Hufflepuff or Ravenclaw, this show has something for you.----

Nerdvana is a brand new monthly show at the Push Comedy Show.  It's a comedy show for nerds, by nerds.  Each month we lovingly poke fun at some of our favorite sci-fi and fantasy books, tv shows and movies.  Star Wars, Game of Thrones, Doctor Who and more... nothing is safe.  If you are a fan of all things nerd, you'll love this show.

Nerdvana presents: Harry Potter and the Cauldron of Comedy

Saturday, March 30th at 8pm.

Tickets are $10

Free for kids or if you come in costume.

Riddikulus!!!!

title: The Improvised Fairy Tale: A Kid Friendly Show
description:
You are cordially invited to join the Brothers and Sisters Grimm as they create an “Improvised Fairy Tale.”  Tales of daring feats, magic spells, and funny characters will be made up on the spot using your suggestions. This family-friendly event will feature a never to be seen again improvised story at the Push Comedy Theater the last Sunday of every month.

“The Improvised Fairy Tale” is part of the Children’s Programming available at Push Comedy Theater and is produced by The Brothers and Sisters Grimm.  The performers are made up of a rotating cast of improvisers that train and perform at Push Comedy Theater.

Children are encouraged to come in costumes and will be welcome to meet the cast in their costumes after the show.
full_description:
You are cordially invited to join the Brothers and Sisters Grimm as they create an “Improvised Fairy Tale.” Tales of daring feats, magic spells, and funny characters will be made up on the spot using your suggestions. This family-friendly event will feature a never to be seen again improvised story at the Push Comedy Theater the last Sunday of every month.

“The Improvised Fairy Tale” is part of the Children’s Programming available at Push Comedy Theater and is produced by The Brothers and Sisters Grimm. The performers are made up of a rotating cast of improvisers that train and perform at Push Comedy Theater.

Children are encouraged to come in costumes and will be welcome to meet the cast in their costumes after the show.

title: 3 on 3 Improv Tournament - The Championship
description:
IT'S MARCH MADNESS AT THE PUSH!!!



We're proud to announce the return of the Push Comedy Theater 3 on 3 Improv Tournament.



Don't miss this elimination style competition for 3 on 3 improv supremacy! Will one of the improv powerhouses be crowned champion, or will a Cinderella story take it all?

For the Championship, each team will be given 20 minutes to dazzle both the audience and our secret panel of judges with their improv skills.

Don't miss these great match ups:Seeds to be announced...

This event is going to be huge, so get your tickets now.

title: Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love
description:
Get ready as we improvise your relationship.

It's the most fun you'll ever have on date night!

Two lucky couples will see their love unfold on stage through the interpretation of 2 of Hampton Roads' wackiest improvisers!

The couples will be selected at random and interviewed on stage in front of the audience. Using the information they learn, and their imagination, Brad and Alba will show the story of the couples' love.

For years, The Pushers have been getting to know diverse couples all across Hampton Roads with this signature piece. Normally this is a piece within a larger show. This time, Brad and Alba are out to explore as much as possible by bringing it to you as its own show!



Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love

Friday, April 5th at 8pm

Tickets are $10

---

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For more than 11 years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. In November of 2014, they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Monocle: The Improvised One-Act Play!
description:
Monocle: The Improvised One-Act Play is a group of five good friends with over 50 years of stage & improv experience looking to make you laugh your ass off!

Here's how our show works:

We ask the audience for any song lyric (except "Hit me, baby, one more time." Ew.) With that one lyrical suggestion, we will improvise an entire one-act play!

We come up with big, funny characters and compelling storylines right in front of your eyes. It may be dramatic, maybe even a little tragic, but it's always funny (we are dipshits)!

Our show may look like we rehearsed it somehow, but we promise you there is no script. Just lots of laughs & lots of fun!

Comedy! Drama! Spectacle! Monocle!Monocle: The Improvised One-Act PlayFirst Friday of the month at the Push Comedy TheaterThe show starts at 10 pm, tickets are $5

---

title: The Unusual Suspects (formerly Who Dunnit)
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

There’s been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the world’s greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

You’ll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show that’s played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isn’t your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the world’s greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

You’ll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show that’s played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isn’t your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Tales from the Campfire: The Improvised Ghost Story
description:
I ain't afraid of no ghost!

The Push presents a frightful night of comedy (or is it a hilarious night of frights).

Tales from the Campfire is quickly becoming one of the Push's biggest hits.



With an audience suggestion, this talented group of improvisers will make up a series of gut-busting ghost story right before your eyes.



Tales from the Campfire: The Improvised Ghost Story

First Saturday of the month at 8pm

Tickets are $10

title: Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love
description:
Get ready as we improvise your relationship.

It's the most fun you'll ever have on date night!

Two lucky couples will see their love unfold on stage through the interpretation of 2 of Hampton Roads' wackiest improvisers!

The couples will be selected at random and interviewed on stage in front of the audience. Using the information they learn, and their imagination, Brad and Alba will show the story of the couples' love.

For years, The Pushers have been getting to know diverse couples all across Hampton Roads with this signature piece. Normally this is a piece within a larger show. This time, Brad and Alba are out to explore as much as possible by bringing it to you as its own show!



Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love

Friday, June 7th at 8pm

Tickets are $10

---

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For more than 11 years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. In November of 2014, they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

title: Monocle: The Improvised One-Act Play!
description:
Monocle: The Improvised One-Act Play is a group of five good friends with over 50 years of stage & improv experience looking to make you laugh your ass off!

Here's how our show works:

We ask the audience for any song lyric (except "Hit me, baby, one more time." Ew.) With that one lyrical suggestion, we will improvise an entire one-act play!

We come up with big, funny characters and compelling storylines right in front of your eyes. It may be dramatic, maybe even a little tragic, but it's always funny (we are dipshits)!

Our show may look like we rehearsed it somehow, but we promise you there is no script. Just lots of laughs & lots of fun!

Comedy! Drama! Spectacle! Monocle!Monocle: The Improvised One-Act PlayFirst Friday of the month at the Push Comedy TheaterThe show starts at 10 pm, tickets are $5

---
